samples.question: Well Grandparents Are the Pillar of a Family?
samples.transcript: Because they are experienced people. So they share their past experiences, be good and bad and support the family. They help raising children in my culture especially as I am from India. So in Indian culture that grandparents usually take care of the grand children in the absence of their parents and when they have busy working life. So grandparents are always supportive. They will always be there to take care of the entire family.

They help raising children in my culture especially as I am from India. So in Indian culture that grandparents usually take care of the grand children in the absence of their parents and when they have busy working life. So grandparents are always supportive. They will always be there to take care of the entire family.

samples.question: Do you think children benefit from living with their grandparents?
samples.transcript: Yes why not children always get so many benefits while living with their grandparents well they can develop many social and many moral values ​​because their grandparents teach them how they can lead a good life how they can be good individuals for example they can teach them many skills cooperation honesty and integrity and they can develop some other virtues like discipline in and how they must live their life. So definitely it is how the relationship between grandparents and grandchildren has changed overtime. Yes it has been changed a lot. In fact, I would say a dramatic change I have noticed from that life and this life. In the past people used to live in joint households and that at that time and age as a result grand parents and grand children had close bonding but now a days due to urbanization and busy lifestyle people have started living separately in urban areas so there is now a weak connection between the grandparents and the grand children however still video calling is happening these are helping children and family members to stay connected with their elders. Should grandparents be involved in making decisions for their grandchildren in my point of view and in my opinion to a certain extent but not a lot. They can help in decision making like some for health and for discipline and some other easy go matters because there is a big generation gap between grand children and the grand parents. I think parents can play a vital role in making decisions. Because parents are more close to their children and they are adaptable to technology and the new things. So They Can Guide Better to Their Children.

samples.question: What are some traditional values ​​that grandparents often teach?
samples.transcript: Well, as I am I have also been raised by my grandparents. So I would like to get my example. My grandparents used to teach me about respecting others, honesty, hard work, integrity, disciplined life, gentle to others, politeness. So I think every grandparent can inculcate true values ​​in their grandchildren.
samples.transcript_original: Well, as I am I have also been raised by my grandparents. So I would like to get my example. My grandparents used to teach me about respecting others, honesty, hard work, integrity, disciplined life, gentle to others, politeness. So I think every grandparent can inculcate true values ​​in their grandchildren.

My grandparents used to teach me about respecting others, honesty, hard work, integrity, disciplined life, gentle to others, politeness. samples.question: How Can Modern Life Affect the Bond Between Young People and Their Grandparents?
samples.transcript: A lot. It is a not it can actually it is affecting a lot. Earlier people used to spend quality time with their grandparents but now a days but with the passage of time and things has been changed technology is there and urbanization and the lifestyle so people are being busy so and at that time they are not having enough time to stay and be with their grandparents so it is affecting their relationship a lot or it is really it is dramatically affecting their life.
